questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :


Statement I : Colourless cupric metaborate is reduced to cuprous metaborate in a luminous
flame.


Statement II : Cuprous metaborate is obtained by heating boric anhydride and copper
sulphate in a non-luminous flame.


In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options
given below.
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
options.B: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.C: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.D: Both Statement I and Statement II are true

questions.question_text:
Let Bi (i = 1, 2, 3) be three independent events in a sample space. The probability that only B1 occur is $$\alpha $$, only B2 occurs is $$\beta $$ and only B3 occurs is $$\gamma $$. Let p be the probability that none of the events Bi occurs and these 4 probabilities satisfy the equations $$\left( {\alpha  - 2\beta } \right)p = \alpha \beta $$ and $$\left( {\beta  - 3\gamma } \right)p = 2\beta \gamma $$ (All the probabilities are assumed to lie in the interval (0, 1)).
 Then $${{P\left( {{B_1}} \right)} \over {P\left( {{B_3}} \right)}}$$ is equal to ________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let B_{i} (i = 1, 2, 3) be three independent events in a sample space. The probability that only B_{1} occur is $$\alpha $$, only B_{2} occurs is $$\beta $$ and only B_{3} occurs is $$\gamma $$. Let p be the probability that none of the events B_{i} occurs and these 4 probabilities satisfy the equations $$\left( {\alpha  - 2\beta } \right)p = \alpha \beta $$ and $$\left( {\beta  - 3\gamma } \right)p = 2\beta \gamma $$ (All the probabilities are assumed to lie in the interval (0, 1)). Then $${{P\left( {{B_1}} \right)} \over {P\left( {{B_3}} \right)}}$$ is equal to ________.

questions.question_text:
n mole of a perfect gas undergoes a cyclic process ABCA (see figure) consisting of the following processes.

A $$ \to $$ B : Isothermal expansion at temperature T so that the volume is doubled from V1 to V2 = 2V1 and pressure charges from P1 to P2

B $$ \to $$ C : Isobaric compression at pressure P2 to initial volume V1.

C $$ \to $$ A : Isochoric change leading to change of pressure from P2 to P1.

Total workdone in the complete cycle ABCA is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: n mole of a perfect gas undergoes a cyclic process ABCA (see figure) consisting of the following processes.A $$ \to $$ B : Isothermal expansion at temperature T so that the volume is doubled from V_{1} to V_{2} = 2V_{1} and pressure charges from P_{1} to P_{2}B $$ \to $$ C : Isobaric compression at pressure P_{2} to initial volume V_{1}.C $$ \to $$ A : Isochoric change leading to change of pressure from P_{2} to P_{1}.Total workdone in the complete cycle ABCA is :

questions.question_text:
In the given figure, the energy levels of hydrogen atom have been shown along with some transitions marked A, B, C, D and E.

The transitions A, B and C respectively represent :
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: The series limit of Lyman series, second member of Balmer series and second member of Paschen series.
options.B: The ionization potential of hydrogen, second member of Balmer series and third member of Paschen series.
options.C: The series limit of Lyman series, third member of Balmer series and second member of Paschen series.
options.D: The first member of the Lyman series, third member of Balmer series and second member of Paschen series.

questions.question: In the given figure, the energy levels of hydrogen atom have been shown along with some transitions marked A, B, C, D and E.The transitions A, B and C respectively represent :

questions.question_text:
The work done by a gas molecule in an isolated system is 

given by, $$W = \alpha {\beta ^2}{e^{ - {{{x^2}} \over {\alpha kT}}}}$$, where x is the displacement, k is the Boltzmann constant and T is the temperature. $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ are constants. Then the dimensions of $$\beta$$ will be :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The work done by a gas molecule in an isolated system is given by, $$W = \alpha {\beta ^2}{e^{ - {{{x^2}} \over {\alpha kT}}}}$$, where x is the displacement, k is the Boltzmann constant and T is the temperature. $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ are constants. Then the dimensions of $$\beta$$ will be :

questions.question_text: Two stars of masses m and 2m at a distance d rotate about their common centre of mass in free space. The period of revolution is :
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: Two equal capacitors are first connected in series and then in parallel. The ratio of the equivalent capacities in the two cases will be :
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text:
Moment of inertia (M. I.) of four bodies, having same mass and radius, are reported as; 

I1 = M.I. of thin circular ring about its diameter,

I2 = M.I. of circular disc about an axis perpendicular to disc and going through the centre,

I3 = M.I. of solid cylinder about its axis and

I4 = M.I. of solid sphere about its diameter.

Then :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Moment of inertia (M. I.) of four bodies, having same mass and radius, are reported as; I_{1} = M.I. of thin circular ring about its diameter,I_{2} = M.I. of circular disc about an axis perpendicular to disc and going through the centre,I_{3} = M.I. of solid cylinder about its axis andI_{4} = M.I. of solid sphere about its diameter.Then :

questions.question_text: An unpolarised light beam is incident on the polarizer of a polarization experiment and the intensity of light beam emerging from the analyzer is measured as 100 Lumens. Now, if the analyzer is rotated around the horizontal axis (direction of light) by 30$$^\circ$$ in clockwise direction, the intensity of emerging light will be _________ Lumens.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: An unpolarised light beam is incident on the polarizer of a polarization experiment and the intensity of light beam emerging from the analyzer is measured as 100 Lumens. Now, if the analyzer is rotated around the horizontal axis (direction of light) by 30$$^\circ$$ in clockwise direction, the intensity of emerging light will be _________ Lumens.

questions.question_text: A ball with a speed of 9 m/s collides with another identical ball at rest. After the collision, the direction of each ball makes an angle of 30$$^\circ$$ with the original direction. The ratio of velocities of the balls after collision is x : y, where x is __________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A ball with a speed of 9 m/s collides with another identical ball at rest. After the collision, the direction of each ball makes an angle of 30$$^\circ$$ with the original direction. The ratio of velocities of the balls after collision is x : y, where x is __________.

questions.question_text: An electromagnetic wave of frequency 5 GHz, is travelling in a medium whose relative electric permittivity and relative magnetic permeability both are 2. Its velocity in this medium is ____________ $$\times$$ 107 m/s.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: An electromagnetic wave of frequency 5 GHz, is travelling in a medium whose relative electric permittivity and relative magnetic permeability both are 2. Its velocity in this medium is ____________ $$\times$$ 10^{7} m/s.

questions.question_text: A hydraulic press can lift 100 kg when a mass 'm' is placed on the smaller piston. It can lift ___________ kg when the diameter of the larger piston is increased by 4 times and that of the smaller piston is decreased by 4 times keeping the same mass 'm' on the smaller piston.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A hydraulic press can lift 100 kg when a mass 'm' is placed on the smaller piston. It can lift ___________ kg when the diameter of the larger piston is increased by 4 times and that of the smaller piston is decreased by 4 times keeping the same mass 'm' on the smaller piston.

questions.question_text: An inclined plane is bent in such a way that the vertical cross-section is given by $$y = {{{x^2}} \over 4}$$ where y is in vertical and x in horizontal direction. If the upper surface of this curved plane is rough with coefficient of friction $$\mu$$ = 0.5, the maximum height in cm at which a stationary block will not slip downward is _________ cm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: An inclined plane is bent in such a way that the vertical cross-section is given by $$y = {{{x^2}} \over 4}$$ where y is in vertical and x in horizontal direction. If the upper surface of this curved plane is rough with coefficient of friction $$\mu$$ = 0.5, the maximum height in cm at which a stationary block will not slip downward is _________ cm.

questions.question_text: A common transistor radio set requires 12 V (D.C.) for its operation. The D.C. source is constructed by using a transformer and a rectifier circuit, which are operated at 220 V (A.C.) on standard domestic A.C. supply. The number of turns of secondary coil are 24, then the number of turns of primary are ___________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A common transistor radio set requires 12 V (D.C.) for its operation. The D.C. source is constructed by using a transformer and a rectifier circuit, which are operated at 220 V (A.C.) on standard domestic A.C. supply. The number of turns of secondary coil are 24, then the number of turns of primary are ___________.

questions.question_text: The coefficient of static friction between a wooden block of mass 0.5 kg and a vertical rough wall is 0.2. The magnitude of horizontal force that should be applied on the block to keep it adhere to the wall will be _________ N. [g = 10 ms$$-$$2]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The coefficient of static friction between a wooden block of mass 0.5 kg and a vertical rough wall is 0.2. The magnitude of horizontal force that should be applied on the block to keep it adhere to the wall will be _________ N. [g = 10 ms^{$$-$$2}]

questions.question_text: In connection with the circuit drawn below, the value of current flowing through 2 k$$\Omega$$ resistor is _________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$4 A.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In connection with the circuit drawn below, the value of current flowing through 2 k$$\Omega$$ resistor is _________ $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$4} A.

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : 

Statement I : Two photons having equal linear momenta have equal wavelengths.

Statement II : If the wavelength of photon is decreased, then the momentum and energy of a photon will also decrease.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.C: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.D: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

questions.question: Given below are two statements : Statement I : Two photons having equal linear momenta have equal wavelengths.Statement II : If the wavelength of photon is decreased, then the momentum and energy of a photon will also decrease.In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.
